entry.title: Unable to Access ‚ÄúDesign, Develop, and Manage APIs‚Äù After Completing Integration Suite Booster
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I‚Äôm currently going through the SAP Integration Suite onboarding tutorials. I successfully completed all the steps in the ‚ÄúEnable the SAP Integration Suite‚Äù booster, and the process completed with a success message.

However, when I moved to the next tutorial: ‚ÄúCreate an API Provider System‚Äù, I got stuck at Step 2, which asks to open the API Management Portal via ‚ÄúDesign, Develop, and Manage APIs‚Äù.

Here‚Äôs what I have already tried:

  • Verified Integration Suite is subscribed in my BTP subaccount

  • Tried re-opening via the ‚ÄúGo to Application‚Äù button

  • Cleared cache and tried Incognito mode

  • Waited for some time in case it was a delay

  • Checked tutorials again, but couldn't find what might be missing

I also tried searching the community and SAP Help, but couldn‚Äôt find a clear solution for this specific issue.

Has anyone faced a similar problem or can guide me on how to enable API Management properly so I can proceed with creating an API Provider?

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Connecting Non-SAP Systems with SAP BTP: APIs, Event Mesh & Integration Suite
entry.content:
Connecting Non-SAP Systems with SAP BTP: APIs, Event Mesh & Integration Suite

Integration is one of the top priorities for SAP customers in 2025. As hybrid IT landscapes grow , combining SAP S/4HANA, legacy systems, and modern SaaS, the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) has become the central layer enabling these systems to talk to each other securely and in real time.

SAP‚Äôs Integration Suite, Event Mesh, and API Management together form the backbone of this connected ecosystem.

 

1. Why Integration Matters More Than Ever

Businesses rarely run fully on SAP alone. You might have Salesforce for CRM, Workday for HR, or custom-built logistics apps. These need to work seamlessly and tirelessly with SAP without faults, sharing customer data, triggering workflows, and ensuring real-time visibility across the value chain.

BTP helps unify all this through open connectors, APIs, and event-driven communication, without touching the core of SAP S/4HANA.

 

2. Integration Suite: The Foundation Layer

SAP Integration Suite offers a unified set of capabilities to design, manage, and monitor integrations between SAP and non-SAP systems.

Cloud Integration
For process-based, message-driven integration between SAP and non-SAP systems. It enables data flow through pre-built integration packages (for example, SAP ‚Üí Salesforce ‚Üí SAP), reducing development time.

API Management
Expose custom APIs from CAP-based apps or legacy systems, and consume REST APIs from third-party platforms. You can control access, apply rate limits, and ensure security via OAuth and API policies.

Integration Advisor
Suggests mappings and interface structures automatically, saving time and improving consistency during design.

Together, these tools simplify how business processes flow across a hybrid landscape.

 

3. Event Mesh: Making Systems Talk in Real Time

SAP Event Mesh introduces an event-driven architecture (EDA) , enabling systems to communicate through business events rather than constant API calls.

External systems can exchange data with SAP applications
When a customer creates an order in a non-SAP app, Event Mesh can instantly notify SAP S/4HANA or a CAP app to start fulfillment.

Processes stay synchronized in real time
Inventory changes, shipment updates, or status alerts are instantly propagated to every connected system , keeping everyone on the same page with standardized information and data.

You avoid modifying S/4HANA directly
By handling custom logic in BTP extensions and event subscribers, you reduce technical debt and simplify upgrades. The clean-core principle stays intact.

Event Mesh therefore acts as the ‚Äúnervous system‚Äù of the landscape, transmitting business signals instantly across applications.

 

4. APIs + Events = The Future of Integration

Modern integration combines APIs for control and events for awareness.
APIs handle structured, request-driven interactions (‚Äúget order details‚Äù), while events handle spontaneous updates (‚Äúorder created‚Äù).

Together, they enable loosely coupled architectures, where systems are connected, but not dependent.

 

5. Real-World Example: A Logistics Scenario

A German manufacturing company runs SAP S/4HANA for order processing, an on-premises warehouse management system (WMS), and a third-party shipping service that provides delivery tracking via REST APIs.

They use SAP BTP to integrate these three worlds, ensuring data consistency, real-time visibility, and a clean SAP core. Let‚Äôs see how the three pillars of integration make it work together.

 

Cloud Integration: The Process Connector

SAP Cloud Integration (part of Integration Suite) acts as the central traffic controller for data between S/4HANA and the warehouse system.

  • Whenever a sales order is created in S/4HANA, Cloud Integration picks up the outbound IDoc or OData event (for example, ‚ÄúSalesOrder.Created‚Äù).
  • It maps this order data into the format expected by the warehouse system, handling data transformations, enrichments, and protocol conversions (like IDoc ‚Üí REST).
  • The integration flow (iFlow) then securely transmits this data over HTTPS to the warehouse‚Äôs REST endpoint or message queue.
  • At the end of the day, the same flow also synchronizes stock levels or order confirmations back into S/4HANA.

This ensures both systems always have the same view of orders and inventory, without manual file transfers or custom scripts.

Result:
Process-based data exchange between SAP and non-SAP systems, fully automated and monitored from BTP.

 

Event Mesh: The Real-Time Messenger

While Cloud Integration handles batch or process-oriented data, Event Mesh ensures real-time responsiveness across the landscape.

  • When the warehouse system marks an order as ‚ÄúDelivered,‚Äù it publishes an event (for example, ‚ÄúDeliveryCreated‚Äù) to the SAP Event Mesh topic.
  • Event Mesh then pushes this event to all subscribed systems, such as the customer portal and CAP-based tracking app on BTP.
  • The subscriber apps instantly receive this update and can trigger follow-up actions, like sending a push notification or updating the customer‚Äôs order status on the web.

Unlike APIs that require constant polling, Event Mesh delivers updates asynchronously and only when needed, making the system more efficient and scalable.

Result:
Real-time synchronization without point-to-point dependencies, enabling instant reactions across systems.

 

API Management: The Secure Gateway

Now that multiple systems generate and consume data, API Management provides a unified and secure access layer for external consumption.

  • The company creates a custom ‚ÄúOrder Tracking‚Äù API that aggregates order and delivery data from both S/4HANA (via Cloud Integration) and the warehouse (via Event Mesh events).
  • This API is managed through SAP‚Äôs API Management service, where policies handle:
    • Security: OAuth 2.0, API keys, and JWT validation
    • Traffic Control: Rate limits, quota management
    • Monitoring: API usage analytics and latency reports
  • The customer portal or mobile app consumes this API securely, allowing users to track their orders end-to-end from a single interface.

Result:
A governed, standardized entry point for all external consumers hence reducing complexity while protecting sensitive business data.

 

6. Key Takeaway

Connecting SAP and non-SAP systems doesn‚Äôt have to mean complex middleware landscapes anymore.
With SAP BTP, Integration Suite, APIs, and Event Mesh provide a unified, scalable, and governed way to achieve cross-system connectivity, without sacrificing your clean-core principles.

Start with one process, make it event-driven, and expand from there.
Integration is no longer a project phase, it‚Äôs an ongoing capability that defines how modern enterprises operate.

 

#SAPBTP #IntegrationSuite #EventMesh #APIManagement #SAPArchitecture #CleanCore #SAPIntegration #EnterpriseArchitecture #DigitalTransformation #SAPDevelopers

entry.title: Update Account Assignment with Custom Price Conditions PO MMPUR SOAP API
entry.content:
Hello There SAP Community, 

 

We used to use the standard Price Conditions in SAP. Here we used the SOAP API MMPUR (https://myXXXXXX-api.s4hana.cloud.sap/sap/bc/srt/scs_ext/sap/mmpur_purchaseorderrequest_in) SAP_COM_0238 to Update the Account Assignment after a PO has been created with a other API. 

 

We used this payload to Update account Assigment M with Sales order references to existing Purchase orders. 

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:proc="http://sap.com/xi/Procurement">
<soapenv:Header/>
   <soapenv:Body>
      <proc:PurchaseOrderRequest>
         <MessageHeader>
            <CreationDateTime>2018-02-27T12:00:00.1234567Z</CreationDateTime>    
            <SenderBusinessSystemID>0M5UKUQ</SenderBusinessSystemID>
            <ReferenceID schemeID="TDD" schemeAgencyID="Orbis" schemeAgencySchemeAgencyID="PON">123</ReferenceID>     
         </MessageHeader>
         <PurchaseOrder>
            <ActionCode>2</ActionCode>
            <PurchaseOrderID>4500000386</PurchaseOrderID>
                   <PurchaseOrderExternalReferenceID>4500000386</PurchaseOrderExternalReferenceID>      
            <SupplierParty>
               <Supplier>2</Supplier>
            </SupplierParty>
            <PurchaseOrderItem>
          <!--  <PurchaseOrderItemExternalRefID>MAT1</PurchaseOrderItemExternalRefID> :-->
               <!--Optional:-->
               <ActionCode>2</ActionCode>
               <!--Optional:-->
               <PurchaseOrderItemID>10</PurchaseOrderItemID>
               <!--Optional:-->
               <AccountAssignment>
                  <!--Optional:-->
                  <AccountAssignmentCategory>M</AccountAssignmentCategory>
                <!--Zero or more repetitions:-->
                  <AccountAssignmentLine>
                     <SalesOrder>55</SalesOrder>
                     <SalesOrderItem>000100</SalesOrderItem>  
                     <GLAccount>301500</GLAccount>                
                  </AccountAssignmentLine>
               </AccountAssignment>      
            </PurchaseOrderItem>
         </PurchaseOrder>
      </proc:PurchaseOrderRequest>
   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

 

This used to be Successfull.

 


Since we went for Custom Price Conditions and Calculation Shemas, it doesnt work anymore and we do get the Error Message:


Function/class MMPUR_AIF_PO_IN was not executed successfully
Purchase Order 4500000386 update failed
Purchase order still contains faulty items
Item 00010 (external ID ) is faulty. Please check the following messages:
Net price must be greater than 0

Even Sometimes we dont get any response at all. 

 

how can we Update the PO using MMPUR SOAP API? 

We need to use the SOAP API to be able to utilize the AIF Functionality in the System. 

 

Kind regards, 

Philipp

entry.title: SOAP API ProductMDMBulkReplicateRequest for creating a product with classification
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We need to create products with related classifications and characteristics via API in S/4 Hana Cloud Public. For with purpose we use standard SOAP API ProductMDMBulkReplicateRequest ( https://api.sap.com/api/PRODUCTMDMBULKREPLICATEREQUEST/overview ). 

But we have a problem: when we're consuming the web service from ABAP Environment ( from custom class from Eclipse ), we get errors  in SOAP Log Message:

 

Log Messages

 
Consumer:
  • Web service processing error; more details in the web service error log on provider side (UTC timestamp 20251027114623; Transact
  • soap-env : http://schemas.xmlsoap. org/soap/envelope/
  • faultcode : soap-env:Server
  • faultstring : Web service processing error; more details in the web service error log on provider side (UTC timestamp 20251027114623; Transa ... Show More
  • lang : en
     
    Provider:
    SRT: Plain SOAP: Reliable messaging (RM) configured, but consumer sends QoS BE request.
     We are trying to call the SOAP web service within SAP: Source and Target both are S4 HANA public cloud system.

 

Here are our actions step-by-step:

1. Created a Communication User in the Maintain Communication Users app  in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition.

2. Created a communication system in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition and added as inbound communication user created in step 1

3.  Created a communication arrangement based on the communication scenario SAP_COM_0009. Deactivate all Outbound Services. And then downloaded WSDL file of Product Master - Replicate from Client to SAP S/4HANA Cloud

4. Created in ADT a service consumption model for the targeted web service from the metadata file from step 3.

5. Created in ADT  an outbound service.

6. Created in ADT  a communication scenario and assign the outbound service to it. Chose the Authentication Methods Basic and X.509.

7.  Then in Communication Arrangements app created another communication arrangement based on our custom communication scenario, as well as a new communication system and an outbound communication user from step 1.

8.  Checked connection: we get "The ping of the outbound service was successful".

9. For the implementation of the outbound call, we used the code sample copied earlier from the service consumption model

I would really appreciate any help. Many thanks in advance for your help.

entry.title: Use APIM extract variable and then use it in the condition string?
entry.content:
Hello APIM experts...

I am fairly new to APIM and I am trying to extract a variable from JSON input and then use that variable within the API condition strings to send it to the appropriate API path. I have tried looking on the interwebs and have read a bunch of posts and am not having any luck.

Here is my example JSON:

{
  "orderNumber" : "123456789",
...
}

I have tried several variants of the following in my Extract Variables policy:

I want to extract orderNumber into a variable and then if that orderNumber matches a pattern, I want to send it to the Proxy Endpoint in/DEVcreateorder and if it matches a different pattern, I want to send it to in/TESTcreateorder.

So my questions would be:

  1. Is this possible?
  2. If possible, how to extract that value into a variable I can use in the condition string within APIM?

Like I said, I have read and tried things I have read to no avail at even extracting the variable yet. Any help is appreciated!

Thanks for taking the time!

Neal

entry.title: Inquiries about OData V4 - API_SALESORDERWITHOUTCHARGE and API_SALESORDER
entry.content:
Hi Expert,
 
I would like to inquire about the OData version 4 (API_SALESORDERWITHOUTCHARGE). Specifically, I need to know which on-premises SAP S/4HANA version will include this API.
 
I was able to find information about this OData V4 in the cloud edition at (https://api.sap.com/api/sap-s4-CE_SALESORDERWITHOUTCHARGE_0001-v1/overview), but I have not been able to find any relevant information for on-premises versions.
 
2. I am also confused about the API_SALESORDER. We are currently using on-premises Version 2023 FPS03, and I can find this API_SALESORDER in our system. However, the documentation at (https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/19d48293097f4a2589433856b034dfa5/3bac8c01d7024ae1b15cf848ce12544e.html), states that this OData V4 information is only available in the 2025 version.
 
Could anyone help to clear this confusion?
 
Thanks and Regards
Tan

entry.title: API Warehouse Order and Task (A2X) / Posting Change / Category 7
entry.content:
Dear experts,

we are using API Warehouse Order and Task (A2X) to syncronize open Warehouse tasks into a legacy automated Warehouse Management system.

The Problem is that Warehouse Tasks to change Inventory Type Codes (Q to free to block) are not retrieved. as the API only read Putaway, Picking, or Internal Movement while Inventory Type Changes are Category 7 / Posting Change.

Any idea what other API to use??

Also investigating:

Overview | Warehouse Physical Stock by Product ‚Äí Read, Update (A2X) | SAP Business Accelerator Hub and

Overview | Material Documents - Read, Create | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

Regards,

 

Dennis

entry.title: API Execution Failed When Trying to Use ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù Feature in SAP Cloud Integration API on BTP Trial
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I recently ran into an issue while experimenting with SAP Cloud Integration on my SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) Trial Account, and I wanted to share my experience here in case anyone else has faced something similar‚Äîor if someone can point me in the right direction.

Scenario

As part of my learning journey in SAP Integration Suite, I created an Integration Flow (iFlow) in Cloud Integration (CPI) and successfully deployed it.

Then, I exposed the iFlow as an API through the API Management capability of BTP so that I could access it externally via a REST API call.

Everything went smoothly until I tried to test the API using the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature from SAP API Business Hub.

Steps Followed

  1. Logged in to my SAP BTP Trial account.

  2. Opened Integration Suite ‚Üí Cloud Integration.

  3. Created and deployed an iFlow that returns some sample data.

  4. Exposed the iFlow as an API Proxy using API Management ‚Üí Design ‚Üí API Proxies.

  5. Opened the Cloud Integration API package on SAP API Business Hub.

  6. Clicked ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù to test one of the APIs (for example, /MessageProcessingLogs).

  7. Given the clientid and clientsecret from instance default_it-rt_integration-flow and also I tried with my BTP sign inuser id and password and it shows API execution failed. Please try again.

    Issue Facing

    When I clicked Execute, the system returned the following message:

    API execution failed. Please try again.

    No additional error details were displayed in the response window, and the API call did not reach my iFlow endpoint.

    Troubleshooting Attempted

    Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôve tried so far:

    • Verified that the iFlow is deployed and active.

    • Checked the runtime URL from the Monitor ‚Üí Manage Integration Content page.

    • Verified that my trial tenant is active and not in suspended state.

    • Checked API Business Hub ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature for other packages ‚Äî same issue occurs, which might indicate an environment limitation.

      My Understanding So Far

      It seems that the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature on SAP API Business Hub might not support BTP Trial environments for certain APIs, especially those requiring authenticated connections to Cloud Integration runtime.

      In a productive BTP setup (non-trial), the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù function usually works fine when proper credentials and destinations are configured.

      Request for Help

      Has anyone successfully used the Cloud Integration API ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature with a Trial account?
      If so, could you please share:

      • Any specific configuration or destination settings needed for trial accounts

      • Whether OAuth token-based authentication is mandatory

      • Or if this limitation is by design for BTP Trial users

        Conclusion

        I‚Äôm learning a lot about SAP Integration Suite and the API Management capabilities on BTP.
        Even though I‚Äôve hit this roadblock, it‚Äôs been a great opportunity to understand how authentication and API exposure work behind the scenes in the SAP ecosystem.

        Would love to hear from the community if anyone has faced and resolved this issue! üôå

entry.title: What is the simplest way you have seen teams manage integration sprawl in SAP landscapes?
entry.content:
As more cloud apps get connected to SAP, the number of small workflows and automations grows quickly. I am trying to understand how teams maintain visibility and control when dozens of integrations start triggering across systems.

Would love to hear if anyone has a clean way of documenting and monitoring these flows without relying too much on custom scripts or manual maps.

entry.title: Configuring OAuth 2.0 Authentication between SAP API Management and SAP Cloud Integration
entry.content:
Alright, let‚Äôs get started, buddy! üòÉ

Assuming API Management is active in your Integration Suite tenant, the first step is to set up the API Proxy.

Step 1: Create an API Proxy to Generate an Access Token 

 

Create an API Proxy using the URL type, and provide any dummy hostname since the target endpoint won‚Äôt actually be invoked.

 

After creating the API Proxy, set the Target Endpoint to ‚ÄúNone‚Äù in the Proxy Endpoint section, as shown in the screenshot below, and click on save.


Step 2 : Add a policy to generate the OAuth 2.0 Authentication.

In the Proxy Endpoint‚Äôs PreFlow, add the OAuth policy, ensuring it is applied on the incoming request stream.

OAuth 2.0 ‚Äì Used to generate the access token for the API call.

<OAuthV2 async="false" continueOnError="false" enabled="true" xmlns="http://www.sap.com/apimgmt">
	<ExternalAuthorization>false</ExternalAuthorization>
	<GrantType>request.queryparam.grant_type</GrantType>
	<Operation>GenerateAccessToken</Operation>
	<GenerateResponse enabled="true"/>
	<SupportedGrantTypes>
		<GrantType>client_credentials</GrantType>
	</SupportedGrantTypes>
</OAuthV2>

Step 3: Create a Product in the Engage section of Integration Suite

Add the API Proxy GenerateAccessToken to the Product APIM_Product

Step 4 : Create a subscription in the Developer Hub

Navigate to Developer Hub ‚Üí My Workspace ‚Üí Create New Subscription (e.g., APIM_Product).



You will get these two items from APIM_Product: The Application Key (your username) and the Application Secret (your password).

Step 5 : Now, let‚Äôs test the API Proxy for GenerateAccessToken

Test the API Proxy using Basic Authentication by supplying the Application Key as the username, the Application Secret as the password, and adding the grant_type as a query parameter. I‚Äôve also attached a screenshot showing the generated access token.

Step 6 : Create API Provider

To validate the setup, you must create an API Provider. Navigate to API Provider, click Create, and enter the following details:

  1. Type: Cloud Integration
  2. Host
  3. Port
  4. Client ID
  5. Client Secret
  6. Token URL*

Click Test Connection; you should receive an ‚ÄúOK‚Äù message with a 200 response code. I‚Äôve attached a screenshot for your reference.

Step 7 : Develop the Integration Flow to serve as the proxy and then deploy it.

I have created a simple Integration Flow that includes a Content Modifier with the body .I‚Äôve attached a screenshot for your reference.

Step 8 : create a proxy using API Provider

Select the provider, click Discover, choose the API, and then click Create


Your proxy will be created and then assign the API Proxy to the Product as shown in below screenshot.

Step 9: Now, let‚Äôs verify the access token
Apply the OAuthV2 policy to the Demo API Proxy.

OAuth 2.0 - To verify the OAuth Token generated.

<OAuthV2 async="false" continueOnError="false" enabled="true" xmlns="http://www.sap.com/apimgmt">
   <ExternalAuthorization>false</ExternalAuthorization>
   <Operation>VerifyAccessToken</Operation>
   <GenerateResponse enabled="true"/>
</OAuthV2>

Assign Message ‚Äì If you encounter the error {"fault":{"faultstring":"Unsupported Encoding \"br\"","detail":{"errorcode":"protocol.http.UnsupportedEncoding"}}}, it's because BR (Brotli) is a compression format typically used by backends for webpage loading, and it is not supported here. Using the Assign Message policy helps remove this unsupported encoding so the message can reach the target successfully


Assign Message 

<AssignMessage async="false" continueOnError="false" enabled="true" xmlns='http://www.sap.com/apimgmt'>
	<Remove>
		<Headers>
			<Header name="Authorization"/>
		</Headers>
	</Remove>
	<IgnoreUnresolvedVariables>false</IgnoreUnresolvedVariables>
	<AssignTo createNew="false" type="request">request</AssignTo>
</AssignMessage>

Click on save and deploy .

Step 9 : Testing Time
In Postman, select OAuth 2.0 as the authentication type, then:

  • Set the Access Token URL
  • Enter the Client ID
  • Enter the Client Secret
  • grant_type=client_credentials
  • Click Get New Access Token


From Cloud Integration

From API Management 

And we‚Äôre done! OAuth 2.0 Authentication is configured for SAP API Management in SAP Cloud Integration. You may now take a victory sip of coffee‚Äîyou earned it üòé

Reference

https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/oauth-v2-0 

https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/security/oauth/oauth-20-client-credentials-grant-type

entry.title: Need guidance to trigger ‚ÄúCarry out new pricing (Type B)‚Äù via API_SALES_ORDER_SRV
entry.content:
1. V2 capability: Does API_SALES_ORDER_SRV (OData V2) support item‚Äëlevel repricing (equivalent to VA02 ‚Üí Pricing Type B) via any function import/action? If yes, please provide URI, payload, and headers (incl. ETag usage and example). If not, please confirm officially. [2]
  2. Recommended approach: If V2 cannot do this, do you recommend:

    • Switching to OData V4 and calling UpdatePrices? or
    • Using a server‚Äëside BAPI wrapper (BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE with LOGIC_SWITCH-PRICING = 'B') and exposing it via a custom OData service? Please advise pros/cons and SAP‚Äësupported pattern. 
    • Expected (API): way to invoke repricing with Pricing Type ‚ÄúB‚Äù for a specific sales order item‚Äîfunction import/action on API_SALES_ORDER_SRV (V2)

      system Version - SAP S/4HANA 2023
      service pack - 02 (10/2024) FPS

entry.title: SAP BTP Integration Suite Cloud to SAP S4 Private Cloud
entry.content:
Dear All,

Good Day!

Is there any documentation/steps to integrate SAP BTP Integration Suite Cloud to SAP S4 Private Cloud via Oauth2.0 Bearer Token.

Am not finding any documentation from SAP.

Thanks and Regards,

Rajesh PS

entry.title: Error: While connecting from SAP BTP Integration Suite to SAP S4 Cloud Odata
entry.content:
Hello Team,

 

I'm getting below error while connecting from SAP BTP Integration Suite Cloud to SAP S4 Cloud Odata service.

"com.sap.gateway.core.ip.component.odata.exception.OsciException: HTTP Request failed with error : <HOST>: No address associated with hostname, cause: java.net.UnknownHostException: <HOST>: No address associated with hostname"

 

 

 

Thanks and Regards,

Rajesh PS

entry.title: API to post customer invoice with automatic tax calculation and without SD doc reference
entry.content:
Hi experts, 

We are seeking an API equivalent to the standard SAP screen "Create customer invoice" in SAP public cloud. The requirements are as follows:

1. Create FI document type DR (receivables) and DG (customer credit memo) without SD document reference. 
2. Facilitate automatic tax calculation. 
Like a "Calculate tax" flag, we don't need to calculate the tax amount in advance to hardcode them in WSLD. 

We successfully created documents meeting requirement no.1 with the API: Journal Entry by Ledger - Post (Asynchronous) but it has limitations in requirement no.2

Please kindly advise the suitable API and if possible, we highly appreciate it if there is an example payload for reference. 

Best regards,
